description: The Japanese plum yew (Cephalotaxus harringtonia) is truly an amazing plant species. It has attractive evergreen foliage and is able to tolerate a wide range of conditions, from full shade to direct sun. This species has a long lifespan - up to 100 years - making it an outstanding ornamental that will last for generations. Its ornamental value is further enhanced with its light yellow foliage in spring, and its vivid purple ripe fruit. This hardy tree grows well in a variety of climates, making it a versatile addition for any garden. It is also low maintenance and does not require extensive pruning, making it an excellent choice for those looking for an easy-care ornamental. Japanese plum yew is truly a remarkable and impactful species for any garden.
